website_summaries.verdict: If you need something that is wireless and not set off by weight changes, this motion detector alarm can be a decent choice.
pros: Multiple motion sensors can be used together
Capacity to add bed or chair pad sensors
Sensor offers more flexibility than others because it can be hooked up to detect several devices
cons: There is no remote off for the motion sensor
It will sound until you turn it off and back on

customer_reviews.title: BEST solution!! I am SO happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter sleepwalks. This has SAVED my sanity. I have the motion sensor outside her door. It always works perfectly and sounds the doorbell sound on the monitor for me. The best part is, the alert continues until you turn it off. If it were one ding, I may not wake up. This ensures I wake up. If you have someone elderly, or a sleepwalker, or anyone you need to ensure don't leave an area, this is the BEST product. It has helped us so much and I can finally sleep with peace of mind!
customer_reviews.author: Caryn

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up and use

I then use a baby monitor camera to see what he is doing and respond accordingly. This sensor/monitor is s huge help to me. Very easy to set up and use. Thanks for making my caregiver life easier!

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product

customer_reviews.title: This simple system works very well for me. My ...
customer_reviews.text: This simple system works very well for me. My dad has Alzheimer disease, and I needed something that would wake me up at night when and if he got out of bed. I located it in the hallway outside of the bedrooms, mounted to the wall high enough so the cat would not trip it. A doorbell type chime goes off and continues until you turn it off. 3 volume levels on the chime. Since both are battery operated, I make sure to turn both the sensor and chime off after I am awake for the day.

product_meta.title: Smart Caregiver Economy Wireless Monitor and Motion Sensor
product_meta.description: Smart Caregiver’s Economy Cordless Monitor and Motion Sensor system offers caregivers great value & flexibility in wireless monitoring. The wireless motion sensor communicates directly with the wireless Economy Monitor. No other devices are required. Set up is quick and easy. You can add more wireless motion sensors, wireless nurse call buttons, wireless chair or bed sensor pads – up to six total. You can mount with provided mounting tape or screws. Bed mounting: mount motion sensor 6” to 8” from edge of bed at floor level. Above door mounting: Rotate the motion sensor down so it’s facing the floor. By mounting the motion sensor above the door you are able to monitor when someone leaves the room.
feature_bullets: Smart Caregiver Versatile and Economical Wireless Monitoring

System comes with 1 Economy Wireless Monitor and 1 Motion Sensor with swivel bracket for specific area motion sensing. Easy to monitor loved ones getting out of bed or leaving the room. Can be used above or by doorways or next to bed.
The Monitor uses three "C" batteries and measures 5.25" x 4" x 1". The Motion Sensor uses three "AA" batteries and measures 3.5" x 3.5" x 1.5". (Batteries not included)
Monitor is expandable - can handle up to 6 wireless components.
